objective: Restore runtime compatibility on hosts with older NVIDIA drivers and stop false-failing dependency updater CI runs.
scope: Update Dockerfile CUDA/runtime wheel targets to a broader-compatible baseline and harden .github/workflows/CI-runpod_dep.yml so unpinned runpod dependencies do not fail the workflow.
acceptance_criteria: Dockerfile no longer requires CUDA 12.9 host-driver compatibility at container start.
vLLM install path uses CUDA 12.8 wheel index to match the downgraded runtime base image.
CI-runpod_dep workflow exits cleanly when runpod is unpinned or absent instead of failing.
Dependency updater still updates managed runpod pins when a newer major.minor is detected.
No upstream interactions or new secret requirements are introduced.
tests_expected: Review CI-runpod_dep script logic for unpinned runpod skip path
Run CI | Update runpod package version via workflow_dispatch and verify success
Run container startup test on target host to confirm CUDA requirement error is resolved
rollback_plan: Revert Dockerfile CUDA/wheel changes and CI-runpod_dep script updates to restore previous runtime target and updater behavior.
deploy_plan: Apply and validate only in this fork, then verify with fork-local CI and a runtime smoke test on the target GPU driver environment.
threat_model: Primary risks are runtime incompatibility from CUDA baseline mismatch and CI noise from brittle parser logic; mitigated by lowering the CUDA requirement baseline and making updater parsing explicit with safe skip conditions.
